steps.title: Consider how organizations will use recycled eyeglasses.
steps.content: Consider how organizations will use recycled eyeglasses. Most organizations send the eyeglasses to under-served areas in local communities or to developing countries around the world. If you have a preferred group you would like to help by donating eyeglasses, make sure you find an organization that works with that group. Some organizations recycle more than lenses, so you may be able to donate just the frames.

steps.title: Locate volunteer organizations online or elsewhere where you can donate glasses.
steps.content: Locate volunteer organizations online or elsewhere where you can donate glasses. National organizations, such as the Lion's Club, New Eyes for the Needy and others, provide several methods for donating eyeglasses.

steps.title: Check the guidelines to recycle eyeglasses.
steps.content: Check the guidelines to recycle eyeglasses. Some companies may require you to pack any intact lenses encased in plastic or metal frames in corrugated cardboard boxes to protect the eyeglasses. Most organizations prefer that you donate glasses and sunglasses that you have gently used. Do not send loose or broken lenses or frames.

steps.title: Visit the websites for service organizations that recycle eyeglasses.
steps.content: Visit the websites for service organizations that recycle eyeglasses. Most will provide drop-off locations where you can donate glasses. They may provide links to state, regional or national centers.

steps.title: Find independent recycling centers in or near your area.
steps.content: Find independent recycling centers in or near your area. Donating eyeglasses can be easier if you can find a drop-off box close to your work or home. Examples of places with drop-off boxes include local non-profit organizations, volunteer organizations, libraries, churches, community centers, schools, doctors' offices and even coffee shops.

steps.title: Take the eyeglasses to a drop-off center.
steps.content: Take the eyeglasses to a drop-off center. Simply place non prescription or outdated prescription eyeglasses into the designated box.

steps.title: Determine whether you want to recycle glasses at a national organization or a local organization.
steps.content: Determine whether you want to recycle glasses at a national organization or a local organization. The cost to ship your donated eyeglasses to a local organization may be less than the cost to ship them to a national organization.

steps.title: Write down the mailing address for the organization where you will be donating eyeglasses.
steps.content: Write down the mailing address for the organization where you will be donating eyeglasses. Take note of any special instructions provided along with this information.

steps.title: Pack your glasses so they won't break during shipping.
steps.content: Pack your glasses so they won't break during shipping. If you want to donate more than 1 pair of glasses, you can usually package them together.

steps.title: Put postage on the envelop and drop the package off at your local post office.
steps.content: Put postage on the envelop and drop the package off at your local post office. When you donate glasses, the cost of shipping may be tax-deductible, depending on the organization.
